content.description: Sit start at base of arete.  Follow arete and crack on right face up to large shelf.
content.location: Same start as People Fall Apart.

content.description: Very low-angled slab problem. But still steep enough that you do need to be slightly careful. Not honestly a great problem in its own right, but I found it useful to do before doing People Fall Apart so I knew what I was getting into (since slab that shallow is relatively foreign terrain for me).Start on the little boulder below the slab and just climb straight up it. You needn’t use the right arete, but the grade isn’t dramatically different if you do. Avoid the little tree.
content.protection: pad doesn't hurt, but fairly hard to protect
content.location: Shallow slab side of Castle boulder (sort of facing toward Tower boulder)

content.description: SDS, left on the lowest sloper (head-hight when seated) and right hand down low in the crack on a side pull or undercling. Make a couple left hand bumps, a couple right hand bumps, and generally head straight up until you can rock over onto the slab, then finish up the slab. (Don't mantel onto the shelf as with Things Fall Apart — you should have gotten onto the slab prior to that.)Mainly adding this because Things Fall Apart says to start the same as People Fall Apart ... but the latter wasn't in MP.
content.location: Left side of the castle boulder on the face with the giant tree and with a blocky V0 on the right

content.description: Same start as Forever.  Traverse the face and finish same as Things Fall Apart.
Squat start at base of arete with hands matched on large blocky holds.  Follow the line of blocky holds on arete and left face to finish.
content.location: It is in back of boulder; see line of blocky holds on boulder.

content.description: 20 foot boulder, some vertical walls and slab sections.
